com.samsung.android.sdk.chord

Class SchordManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.chord.SchordManager

  • public class SchordManager
extends Object
    This class provides the functionality for managing Chord by hiding all the networking complexity.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    2.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SchordManager.NetworkListener
      This listener interface provides callback methods for network status change events.
      static interface  SchordManager.StatusListener
      This listener interface provides callback methods for Chord Manager events.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int INTERFACE_TYPE_WIFI
      Wi-Fi network interface.
      static int INTERFACE_TYPE_WIFI_AP
      Wi-Fi Access Point network interface.
      static int INTERFACE_TYPE_WIFI_P2P
      Wi-Fi Direct network interface.
      static String SECURE_PREFIX
      Prefix for secured channel names.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SchordManager

        public SchordManager(Context context)
        Creates an SchordManager instance.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to use. Usually your Application.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when Chord is not ready.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the Context passed is invalid.
        Since:
        1.5

      • SchordManager

        public SchordManager(Context context,
             Looper looper,
             SchordManager.NetworkListener listener)
        Creates an SchordManager instance with the specified values.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        looper - The looper object to run callback methods. This is a mandatory parameter.
        listener - The NetworkListener instance for receiving network connection events. You can set it to null if there is no listener.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when Chord is not ready.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the Context passed is invalid.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Stop Chord and release the resources.
        Since:
        1.5

      • getAvailableInterfaceTypes

        public  getAvailableInterfaceTypes()
        Get the list of available network interface types.
        Returns:
        The list of available network interface types. valid interface types are:
        INTERFACE_TYPE_WIFI
        INTERFACE_TYPE_WIFI_AP
        INTERFACE_TYPE_WIFI_P2P
        Since:
        1.0

      • setTempDirectory

        public void setTempDirectory(String tmpDirPath)
        Set the specified directory path to temporarily store the files that are received. If you do not call the method to set the temporary storage directory, file transfers fail. You need to set the directory before you start Chord.
        Parameters:
        tmpDirPath - The directory path to temporarily store the files that are received.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setLooper

        public void setLooper(Looper looper)
        Set the specified looper object to the thread handling callback methods.
        If you do not set a looper object, the looper object associated with the main thread is set automatically.
        Parameters:
        looper - The looper object to run callback methods.
        Since:
        1.5

      • setNetworkListener

        public void setNetworkListener(SchordManager.NetworkListener listener)
        Set the specified NetworkListener instance.
        Parameters:
        listener - The NetworkListener instance for receiving network connection events. You can set it to null if there is no listener.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when no handler is set.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        SchordManager.NetworkListener

      • getNICList

        public String[] getNICList()
        Get the list of available network interfaces.
        Returns:
        The list of available network interface names.
        Since:
        2.0

      • start

        public void start(int interfaceType,
         SchordManager.StatusListener listener)
           throws InvalidInterfaceException
        Create and start the Chord agent with the specified interface type and listener. When Chord is started successfully, the StatusListener.onStarted() callback method is called.
        Parameters:
        interfaceType - The network interface type. You cannot use the same type twice. This is a mandatory parameter.
        listener - The StatusListener instance for receiving Chord Manager events. This is a mandatory parameter.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the arguments passed are invalid.
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when Chord is not ready.
        InvalidInterfaceException - Thrown when an inactive interface type is used.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when Chord fails to initialize.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getAvailableInterfaceTypes()

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop chord. When Chord is stopped successfully, the StatusListener.onStopped() callback method is called.
        Since:
        1.0

      • joinChannel

        public SchordChannel joinChannel(String channelName,
                        SchordChannel.StatusListener listener)
        Join the specified channel with the specified status listener.
        To use secure mode, enable the secured channel by calling setSecureModeEnabled(boolean enabled) and add the prefix SECURE_PREFIX to the channel name.
        Parameters:
        channelName - The channel name. It should always begin with an alphanumeric character. This is a mandatory parameter.
        listener - The StatusListener instance for receiving Chord channel events. This is a mandatory parameter.
        Returns:
        The handle of the channel if it is joined successfully. It returns null otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the arguments passed are invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when joining the channel fails.
        Since:
        1.5

      • leaveChannel

        public void leaveChannel(String channelName)
        Leave the specified channel.
        Parameters:
        channelName - The name of the channel you want to leave.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the argument passed is invalid.
        RuntimeException - Thrown when leaving the channel fails.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getJoinedChannel

        public SchordChannel getJoinedChannel(String channelName)
        Get the channel interface for the specific channel name.
        Parameters:
        channelName - The name of the channel the device has joined. The name is set when calling joinChannel().
        Returns:
        The handle of the channel. It returns null if the specified channel is not a joined channel.
        Since:
        1.5

      • getJoinedChannelList

        public  getJoinedChannelList()
        Get the list of all channel interfaces the device has joined.
        Returns:
        The list of handles of all the channels the device has joined. It returns an empty list if there is no channel the device has joined.
        Since:
        1.5

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Get the own node name.
        Returns:
        The own node name. If Chord has not started, this method returns null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getIp

        public String getIp()
        Get the IPv4 address of own device.
        Returns:
        The IPv4 Address of own device corresponding to the interface type that is set when Chord starts.
        If Chord has not started, this method returns null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setNodeKeepAliveTimeout

        public void setNodeKeepAliveTimeout(int timeoutMsec)
        Set how long the node remains active before the connection times out.
        The specified duration determines the maximum time the node waits for data from another node before marking it as disappeared.
        The default time is 34,000 milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        timeoutMsec - The amount of time in milliseconds the node waits for data from another node before marking it as disappeared.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setSendMultiFilesLimitCount

        public void setSendMultiFilesLimitCount(int count)
        Set the limit for the maximum number of simultaneous files that sendMultiFiles() can send.
        The limit takes effect when this method is called.
        Parameters:
        count - The maximum number of files that can be sent simultaneously.
        Since:
        1.5

      • setSecureModeEnabled

        public void setSecureModeEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable secure mode.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Set to true to enable secure mode, set to false to disable secure mode.
        Since:
        1.5

      • setSmartDiscoveryEnabled

        public void setSmartDiscoveryEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable smart discovery. By default, smart discovery is enabled.
        The discovery time period is adapted by Chord.
        The period is reset to the default value when certain events occur
        a new node joining the network or when the device LCD is turned on.
        You can also reinitialize this period explicitly by calling the resetSmartDiscoveryPeriod() method.
        Parameters:
        enabled - to true to enable smart discovery, set to false to disable smart discovery.
        Since:
        1.5
        See Also:
        isSmartDiscoveryEnabled(), resetSmartDiscoveryPeriod()

      • isSmartDiscoveryEnabled

        public boolean isSmartDiscoveryEnabled()
        Check if smart discovery is enabled for the device.
        Returns:
        True if smart discovery is enabled for the device.
        Since:
        1.5
        See Also:
        setSmartDiscoveryEnabled(boolean)

      • resetSmartDiscoveryPeriod

        public void resetSmartDiscoveryPeriod()
        Reset the smart discovery period for nodes.
        Since:
        1.5
        See Also:
        setSmartDiscoveryEnabled(boolean)
